header.title: LESSON NINE: Uncrossing
authors: Author not specified in provided text

central_thesis: The central thesis is that 'Uncrossing' is a paramount and foundational magickal practice essential for removing persistent blockages and negative patterns (crossed conditions) from an individual's life. These conditions, often self-inflicted or accumulated over time, impede all other ritual work and lead to self-destruction. The text outlines a structured, diligent, and patient system involving specific rituals, oils, baths, and personal responsibility to achieve lasting spiritual and physical healing, emphasizing that there are no 'quick fixes' in true magick.

structure_content.summary: Uncrossing is presented as the most crucial area of magick, capable of addressing nearly any life situation. It is posited as the 'ONLY' way to achieve lasting positive results from rituals, as crossed conditions block progress. A 'Hex' is defined as a sudden, acute bombardment by others, while a 'Crossed Condition' is a subtle, often self-inflicted, permanent problem that goes unnoticed for years, manifesting as persistent issues in relationships, money, or success, and attacking the nervous system.

Uncrossing involves three steps: REMOVAL (identifying and eliminating the TRUE CAUSE), HEALING (a period of adjustment and recovery), and REFOCUSING (directing the person towards a new positive path). The most challenging step is Removal, as individuals often resist change and are accustomed to their problems. The process requires patience, as the mind and body need time to adapt to new feelings and opportunities.

A classic uncrossing oil recipe is provided, consisting of Rose (Spirituality and Love), Bay (Protection and Commanding aspects), Verbena (Cleansing), and Lavender (Calm and Peace). These oils are integral to all stages of the uncrossing process, each contributing specific energetic properties.

White is presented as a spiritual and pure color, lacking material plane connection, making it ideal for magick. It is neutral and highly susceptible to oils, screening out negative energies more effectively than red candles in certain rituals. White candles are recommended for love rituals targeting the spiritual plane to attract better quality, long-term partners, or in conjunction with spiritual oils on red candles for similar effects.

Crossed conditions are often tests from Spirit Planes to determine a Sorcerer's worthiness for power. Overcoming them symbolically involves 'slaying one's Dragon' to become a 'HERO' and break free from 'Karma' or disruptive patterns. Life presents many 'traps' (religion, sex, money, egotism, laziness) that lead people away from their magical path, often manifesting as a lack of control over one's life or fear of control.

Uncrossing rituals often trigger a flow of new insights and greater understanding of one's problems, including sudden revelations about childhood, friends, and family. The REMOVAL period (first stage) is key for this information. Uncrossing rituals are typically performed for seven days, symbolizing the uncrossing of the body's seven Chakras and drawing upon the seven personal planets (Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn). Glass Seven Day candles are recommended for continuous light, though standard tapers can be used. The White Skull candle is an 'excellent uncrossing candle' for extreme or 'Karmic' conditions.

structure_content.chapter_title: How to Work on a Crossed Person
structure_content.summary: The best planetary hours for uncrossing rituals are Venus (love), Jupiter (luck, money), and Sun (health, general issues). The ritual should start in one of these hours. During the ritual, the practitioner must pay close attention to life events, as information will 'pour in'. The process can be painful ('healing crisis') as negative energies are released. Dealing with a crossed person requires a balance of toughness (to prevent relapse into negative ways) and love. Crossed individuals will often fight the removal of their condition. The practitioner must understand this resistance as part of the healing process and remain steadfast, potentially needing other rituals (e.g., Peace oil on a candle for nervousness) to manage the person's reactions.

The severity of a crossed condition depends on its duration. The text uses psychological terms 'neurosis' and 'psychosis' to describe its stages. A 'neurosis' involves painful problem clusters that are difficult to work with but allow general societal function. 'Psychosis' represents advanced behaviors where a person is out of touch with reality, causing serious mental illness, which is much harder to treat magickally. Uncrossing is a healing art; for cases beyond one's expertise, seeking help from other Master Sorcerers or professional healers is advised.

Three stages of crossed conditions are outlined: First Stage (slight feelings of unease, inferiority, anxiety, odd experiences, minor daily troubles), Second Stage (nervousness, self-abnegation, physical symptoms, chronic illness, listlessness, insecurity, feeling like a 'stranger in your own life', rapid decline, need for immediate action), and Third Stage (total incapacitation, violent temper, inability to hold a job, delusions of grandeur, paranoia, suicidal thoughts). It is easier to work on earlier stages, but individuals may remain in a stage for years or rapidly progress. Advanced cases (Third Stage) require professional help (magickal and psychological) and extensive, long-term follow-up rituals, as the mind takes time to repair after years of being crossed.

An 'excellent simple ritual' for uncrossing involves burning specific candles over seven consecutive days, lighted at planetary hours of the Sun or Jupiter. The person's name must be carved on each candle. The ritual candles are: Day 1 - White candle anointed with High Altar Oil. Day 2 - Blue candle anointed with Peace Oil. Day 3 - Yellow Candle anointed with Joy Oil. Day 4 - White Candle anointed with Uncrossing Oil. Day 5 - Blue Candle anointed with Uncrossing and Peace Oil. Day 6 - Yellow Candle anointed with Uncrossing and Joy Oil. Day 7 - White candle anointed with High Altar, Uncrossing and Peace oils. A variation for money problems is provided, using Green and Purple candles with specific oils (Money Drawing, Fast Luck). Powder circles (Bay leaves, Helping Hand, Goona Goona) or inverted triangles of powder are recommended around candles, with powder sprinkled into the flame. Talismans and charm bags can be charged during the ritual, leveraging the diverse energies invoked.

Baths are the 'SINGLE MOST IMPORTANT force' in an uncrossing ritual, providing psychic cleansing and physical purification. Dragon's Blood Crystal and Seven Day Uncrossing are recommended bath mixtures. Practitioners dealing with crossed individuals must also take daily baths for self-cleansing and use floor washes/sprays and Banishing incense in their homes to prevent contagion. The bathing person should visualize their aura being cleansed by white light and think positive thoughts. Baths should last 15-25 minutes, as hot as can be endured, and are beneficial for channeling healing energy to physically affected areas.

Legal cases are presented as difficult situations influenced by 'Demonic forces'. Sorcery can greatly increase success chances against 'GREAT ODDS'. Helping a guilty person is risky, as the practitioner takes on their negative legal energies. Three ritual setups are described: 1) For innocent/wrongly accused: Two white candles (ONE) with High Altar/Uncrossing oil, purple figure candle (TWO) with Fiery Wall of Protection/Uncrossing/High John/Low John, brown candle (THREE) with High/Low John. Black Candle Tobacco incense. Salt (A) and water (B) dishes. Place relevant documents under candle THREE. Performed during Jupiter's hour, 7-day duration. Sprinkle Jalap, Winning, or Helping Hand powder on altar. 2) For a 'guilty' person: Two purple candles (ONE) with Uncrossing/Fiery Command Oils, white candle (TWO) representing person with Fiery Wall of Protection oil (Voodoo powder around it), brown candle (THREE) with POWER oil. Place documents under THREE. Sprinkle Bend-Over powder into flame of brown candle daily. Obeah or Zonka powder for altar 'V'. Performed during Jupiter's hour during the waning moon, 7-day duration. Charm bag with Rose, Lavender, Bay, Galangal, Cinnamon, Tobacco, Hyssop, Lemon Verbena. Requires repaying Spirit planes for victory. 3) For prison release: Two white candles (ONE) with High Altar/Uncrossing oils, purple candle (TWO) for person in prison with Crown of Success/Uncrossing/Fiery Wall of Protection/Fast Luck oils, brown candle (THREE) with 50/50 High John/Low John, yellow candle (FOUR) with Sun/Jupiter oils. Salt (A) and water (B) dishes. Tobacco/Galangal mixture sprinkled around candles. Incense mixture: High John 10%, Low John 10%, Tobacco 10%, Rose Buds 25%, Lavender 10%, Buckthorn Bark 10%, Sulfur/Brimstone 5%, Asafetida 5%, Vetivert 15%. Performed between new and full moon (waxing) at Jupiter's hour, 7-day duration. This ritual requires the person in prison to have truly learned their lesson, as 'MAGICK CANNOT BE CONNED!!!'

After uncrossing, a person must be 'pushed in the right direction' to prevent relapse into old patterns. A general success ritual is provided for newly uncrossed individuals: Two white candles (ONE) with Holy/High Altar/Trinity/Obeah oil. Green candle (TWO) for the person, representing fertility, new beginnings, luck, with oil tailored to specific goals (love oil for love, Crown of Success for success, uncrossing oil). Pink candle (THREE) with Peace/Kindly Spirit oil. Yellow candle (FOUR) with Trinity/Joy oils. Incense: Crown of Success (to open), Kindly Spirit (to close). This is a Seven Day ritual using glass-encased candles, started at the hour of the Sun. The practitioner and the uncrossed person must spend minimum time daily (1-2 hours) with the candles to reorient themselves. The process involves lifting symptoms, defusing negative behaviors, and pushing the person towards positive changes.

This section addresses crossed conditions affecting only one specific area of life (Love, Business, Luck). These are generally easier to handle, with severity depending on duration. Short-term conditions may only require a couple of rituals, while longer ones demand more. Single burn uncrossing rituals are effective for short-term issues, helping focus attention on the problem and suggesting new behaviors to overcome self-limitations.

Dealing with many crossed people can lead to 'CONTAGION,' where the practitioner acquires the same crossed condition. This is likened to the flu and is 'VERY CONTAGIOUS!!!' The author stresses the importance of regularly performing uncrossing and banishing rituals for oneself, family, and home, even daily if working with crossed people, to protect against negative energies and evil intentions.

Successful uncrossing often leads the person to confront those who caused their condition (friends, parents, lovers, institutions). The practitioner must guide this confrontation to be as positive and painless as possible, aiming to transform relationships or facilitate separation. The text acknowledges that individuals contribute to their own crossing ('helped to cross themselves'). A person being uncrossed is 'WIDE OPEN' and vulnerable, so guidance is crucial. In relationships, both partners may need uncrossing.

Uncrossing is vital, as everyone has crossed conditions. It works on psychic, psychological, and physical levels. Many physical diseases and 'DEMONIC POSSESSION!!!' are linked to crossed conditions. Candle burning rituals offer effective solutions for chronic and recent problems. The author advises all magick practitioners to use uncrossing, floor washes, baths, and incenses regularly. Uncrossing rituals provide spiritual rebirth and newfound physical/mental energy, leading to significant positive life changes for diligent practitioners.

key_concepts.definition: The core magickal practice aimed at removing persistent blockages, negative patterns, and spiritual ailments (crossed conditions) from an individual's life, enabling positive results from other magical workings and fostering overall well-being. It is a healing art with three main steps: Removal, Healing, and Refocusing.

A subtle, often self-inflicted, long-term spiritual problem that remains unnoticed for years, manifesting as persistent difficulties in specific life areas (e.g., relationships, finances, success) and often affecting the nervous system. Unlike a hex, it is typically an internal blockage or self-sabotage rather than an external attack.
A sudden or acute magical bombardment or attack sent by other people, either directly or indirectly, with malicious intent, causing immediate negative effects.

The systematic approach to uncrossing, comprising (1) REMOVAL of the true cause of the crossed condition, (2) HEALING to allow the individual to recover and adjust, and (3) REFOCUSING to guide them onto a new, positive life path.

Negative and disruptive patterns of behavior or destiny that can be overcome through consistent and dedicated uncrossing rituals and personal transformation, freeing an individual from being 'lead by their destiny' to choose their own.

The phenomenon where a practitioner or individual can absorb or 'catch' the crossed conditions or negative energies of others, especially when frequently interacting with 'crossed people' without adequate protection. This is likened to a contagious illness.

A standard duration for uncrossing rituals, where candles and associated workings are performed for seven consecutive days. This period symbolically aligns with the uncrossing of the body's seven Chakras and draws upon the influences of the seven personal planets.

A candle color considered spiritual and pure, representing the lack of material connection and being highly receptive to applied oils. It is particularly effective for screening out negative energies and working on the Higher Spiritual Plane, making it valuable for spiritual goals and long-term results.

Specific astrological hours ruled by different planets, used to time rituals for optimal effect. Venus hours are for love conditions, Jupiter hours for luck and money, and Sun hours for health problems or as a general starting time for multi-faceted issues.

A period during the uncrossing process where negative energies flow out of the individual, causing temporary pain or discomfort, analogous to a physical healing crisis. It is a sign that the cleansing process is actively working.

A principle stating that the Spirit Planes will not grant success or intervention in magical workings (particularly in legal cases or situations involving past wrongdoings) unless the individual seeking help has genuinely learned their lesson or reformed their behavior. Magick does not circumvent personal responsibility or ethical consequences.

practical_system.description: The system presented is a structured, operative approach to 'Uncrossing,' a specialized form of cleansing magic. It begins with diagnosis, distinguishing between external 'Hexes' and internal 'Crossed Conditions,' often self-inflicted and requiring deep introspection. The core method involves a three-stage process: Removal (identifying and eliminating the root cause), Healing (recovery and adjustment), and Refocusing (establishing a new, positive life path). This process is typically conducted over seven consecutive days, utilizing specific candle rituals timed to planetary hours, anointed with purpose-specific oils, and supported by baths, incense, and protective measures. Personal responsibility, diligence, and patience are stressed as non-negotiable for success. Post-uncrossing rituals are also crucial for 'reorienting' the individual and preventing relapse, while strict protective practices are advised for practitioners to avoid 'contagion' from clients.

Oils (High Altar, Peace, Joy, Uncrossing, Fiery Wall of Protection, Crown of Success, Spirit Oil, Love Oil, Money Drawing, Fast Luck, Trinity, Kindly Spirit, Obeah, Power, Command)
Herbal Powders (Bay leaves, Helping Hand, Goona Goona, Jalap, Winning powder, Bend-Over, Obeah, Zonka)
Incense (Black Candle Tobacco, Crown of Success, Kindly Spirit, Banishing incense mixture specified for prison release)

Herbs (Blessed Thistle, Pine, Bay, Verbena, Lavender, Vetivert, Rose, Camellia, Storax, Jupiter, Cascara Sagrada, Blackthorn, Galangal, Cinnamon, Tobacco, Hyssop, Rose Buds, Buckthorn Bark, Sulfur/Brimstone, Asafetida)
Doll (White cloth, purple thread, stuffed with specified herbs and oils for legal/personal work)
Salt and Water (in dishes, as ritual components)
Charm bags (for carrying protective and legal herbs/powders)
rituals: General Seven Day Uncrossing Ritual (Candle sequence and anointing)
Seven Day Money Problems Ritual (Specific candle colors and oils for financial uncrossing)
Legal Case Ritual (Innocent/Wrongly Accused: Specific candle setup, powders, and document placement)
Legal Case Ritual (Guilty Person: Different candle setup, specific powders, emphasis on genuine reform)
Prison Release Ritual (Complex candle setup, specific oils, incense mixture, and planetary timing, contingent on reform)
Reorienting and Protection Ritual (Post-uncrossing success ritual for new beginnings and preventing relapse)
Single Burn Uncrossing Rituals (For short-term, specific crossed conditions)
Bathing Rituals (Daily ritual with specific bath mixtures for psychic cleansing and aura purification)
Banishing and Protection Rituals (Daily use of floor washes, sprays, and incense for practitioner and home protection)

relevant_quotes.text: Uncrossing is one of the most important areas of magick you will ever study. Uncrossing can handle just about any situation you will come across in your magickal life. Many times it is the ONLY way to help yourself or another person. If they are crossed you will never get lasting or any possible and positive results from your rituals.

The difference between a HEX and a CROSSED CONDITION is that a Hex is a sudden or acute bombardment, while a Crossed condition is something that goes unnoticed for years as a simple, but permanent problem.
A Crossed Condition is usually caused by YOU!!!
There are three steps to UNCROSSING: REMOVAL, HEALING, and last but not least REFOCUSING.
Nothing is more important to an uncrossing procedure than baths. This is the SINGLE MOST IMPORTANT force in an uncrossing ritual.
MAGICK CANNOT BE CONNED!!! Unless the person has truly reformed, they will not be freed by the use of magick.
Crossed conditions are like the flue, they are VERY CONTAGIOUS!!!
THERE ARE NO QUICK FIXES HERE!!! YOU GET WHAT YOU WORK HARD FOR!!!

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant to contemporary occultism, particularly within folk magic traditions (e.g., Hoodoo, Rootwork) and modern eclectic practices that emphasize practical problem-solving and self-empowerment. The clear distinction between a 'hex' and a 'crossed condition' offers practitioners a refined diagnostic tool, while the focus on self-responsibility and internal blockages aligns with psychological trends in modern magical thought. The concept of 'contagion' provides a practical warning often overlooked in less operative texts. The structured 7-day rituals and specific planetary timings are classical grimoire elements, adapted for accessible candle magic. Its emphasis on diligence, patience, and ethical considerations (e.g., 'Magick Cannot Be Conned') serves as a valuable counterpoint to 'instant gratification' approaches often found in commercialized occultism.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes aspiring or experienced practitioners of practical magick, especially those involved in candle magic, Hoodoo, or other folk magic systems focused on personal cleansing and protection. It is also highly relevant for individuals experiencing persistent, unexplained life problems (crossed conditions) who seek operative magical solutions. The text serves as a guide for self-work, as well as for those performing healing work for others, emphasizing the ethical and practical challenges inherent in such roles (e.g., 'handling crossed persons'). The detailed instructions make it suitable for a committed student willing to invest time and effort into the practice.
